page.title: 18THE VILLAGE OF SHREWTON.
page.content: The housing in the village varies in age, style and size. The oldest residences include Maddington Grange, Maddington Manor, Shrewton Manor, and the Old School House which all date back to the seventeenth century. Later buildings include attractive cottages, along the High Street, made of chalk mud and rubble, or brick and flint. The Flood cottages were built after the Great Till Flood of January 1841, when thirty houses were destroyed and three people died. Tanners Lane has been redeveloped during the past thirty-five years, the old cottages being replaced by more modern, privately-owned, dwellings. Other developments since the Second World War include a large council estate built in 1957 called Furlong Way. Meadway, a private housing estate, was built in 1968.
